verses.verse: (Jer. 47:1) But I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza, Which shall devour its palaces.

I will cut off the inhabitant (Jer. 47:5; Zeph. 2:4) from Ashdod, And the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon; I will (Ps. 81:14) turn My hand against Ekron, And (Is. 14:29-31; Jer. 47:1-7; Ezek. 25:16; Joel 3:4-8; Zeph. 2:4-7; Zech. 9:5-7) the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,” Says the Lord GOD.

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (Is. 23:1-18; Jer. 25:22; Ezek. 26:2-4; Joel 3:4-8) Tyre, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom, And did not remember the covenant of brotherhood.
But I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, Which shall devour its palaces.”

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (Is. 21:11; Jer. 49:8; Ezek. 25:12-14; Mal. 1:2-5) Edom, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because he pursued his (Num. 20:14-21; 2 Chr. 28:17; Obad. 10-12) brother with the sword, And cast off all pity; His anger tore perpetually, And he kept his wrath forever.
But (Jer. 49:7, 20; Obad. 9, 10) I will send a fire upon Teman, Which shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.”

Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (Jer. 49:1; Ezek. 25:2; Zeph. 2:8, 9) the people of Ammon, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they ripped open the women with child in Gilead, That they might enlarge their territory.

But I will kindle a fire in the wall of (Deut. 3:11; 1 Chr. 20:1; Jer. 49:2) Rabbah, And it shall devour its palaces, (Ezek. 21:22; Amos 2:2) Amid shouting in the day of battle, And a tempest in the day of the whirlwind.
(Jer. 49:3) Their king shall go into captivity, He and his princes together,” Says the LORD.

Thus says the LORD: (Is. 15:1-16; Jer. 25:21; Ezek. 25:8-11; Zeph. 2:8-11) “For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because he (2 Kin. 3:26, 27) burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime.
But I will send a fire upon Moab, And it shall devour the palaces of (Jer. 48:24, 41) Kerioth; Moab shall die with tumult, With shouting and trumpet sound.
And I will cut off (Num. 24:17; Jer. 48:7) the judge from its midst, And slay all its princes with him,” Says the LORD.

Judgment on Judah Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (2 Kin. 17:19; Hos. 12:2; Amos 3:2) Judah, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, (Lev. 26:14) Because they have despised the law of the LORD, And have not kept His commandments. (Is. 9:15, 16; 28:15; Jer. 16:19; Hab. 2:18) Their lies lead them astray, Lies (Jer. 9:14; 16:11, 12; Ezek. 20:13, 16, 18) which their fathers followed.
(Jer. 17:27; Hos. 8:14) But I will send a fire upon Judah, And it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”

Judgment on Israel Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (Judg. 2:17-20; 2 Kin. 17:7-18; 18:12; Ezek. 22:1-13, 23-29) Israel, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because (Is. 29:21) they sell the righteous for silver, And the (Joel 3:3; Amos 4:1; 5:11; 8:6; Mic. 2:2; 3:3) poor for a pair of sandals.

They pant after the dust of the earth which is on the head of the poor, And (Amos 5:12) pervert the way of the humble. (Lev. 18:6-8; Ezek. 22:11) A man and his father go in to the same girl, (Lev. 20:3; Ezek. 36:20-22) To defile My holy name.
